# Task

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.



# Data

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0),3)

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    # Check that dt is a DateTime object
    if !isa(dt, DateTime)
        throw(ArgumentError("timezone_bumper only works with DateTime objects"))
    end
    
    # Convert the DateTime to a UTC DateTime
    utc = convert(DateTime, dt, Dates.UTC)
    
    # Add the bump hours to the UTC time
    new_utc = utc + Dates.Hour(bump)
    
    # Convert the new UTC time back to the original timezone
    return convert(dt.zone, new_utc)
end
